metadata.Title: CVE-2018-4133 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in certain Apple products. Safari before 11.1 isaffected. The issue involves the "WebKit" component. A Safari cross-sitescripting (XSS) vulnerability allows remote attackers to inject arbitraryweb script or HTML via a crafted URL.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-4133` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.20.0-2
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.20.0-2
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.20.0-2
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.20.0-2
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.20.0-2
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.20.0-2
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.20.0-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: webkitgtk package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.20.0-2').
qtwebkit-source package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
